definition: to boil/to roll/to take a hike/Get lost!
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: Put the small balls into the boiling water until they become flowing.
sentences.chinese: 把搓好的小丸子放入滾水中煮滾及浮起。

sentences.english: Poach fresh shrimps in water until boiled.
Wash pork spare-rib. Blanch the spare-rib in boiling water, remove.
sentences.chinese: 小排骨洗淨，放入滾水中燙過，取出備用。

sentences.english: Blanch the udon in boiling water for 2 minutes. Rinse under cold running water and drain.
sentences.chinese: 烏冬在滾水中煮2分鐘，取出在水龍頭下過冷河瀝乾。

sentences.english: Place pea shoots into boiled water. When cooked, take out and place on a dish.
sentences.chinese: 預備滾水，放入豆苗灼熟，然後用碟盛起。

sentences.english: Rinse yunnan ham with boiling water and shred.
sentences.chinese: 金華火腿過滾水後切幼絲。

sentences.english: Wash and parboilduck tongues in boiling water for 5 minutes. Rinse and drainwell.
sentences.chinese: 鴨脷洗淨，放入滾水中煮5分鐘，取出洗淨。

sentences.english: Using a slotted spoon ease dumplings into the boiling salted water and let boil.
sentences.chinese: 用漏勺將丸子慢慢放入滾水鍋裏煮沸。

sentences.english: Scald pork ribs with boiling water, remove and drain.
sentences.chinese: 排骨放入滾水內川燙，撈起瀝乾水份。

sentences.english: Blanch lotus leaf until soft, brush with sesame oil.
sentences.chinese: 荷葉放滾水內拖軟，掃上麻油。

sentences.english: In both cases, the idea of heat and boiling is connected with the feeling of anger.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個例子中，熱氣和滾水用來形容生氣的樣子。

sentences.english: Wash and parboil duck tongues in boiling water for 5 minutes. Rinse and drain well.
sentences.chinese: 鴨脷洗淨，放入滾水中煮5分鐘，取出洗淨。

sentences.english: Add the fish balls into boiling water.
Blanch in hot water and dip immediately in ice water to stop cooking.
sentences.chinese: 在滾水灼熟後立即放進冰水中。

sentences.english: If you cook an egg, putting it in boiling water, you trust the egg will be boiled.
sentences.chinese: 如果你煮個蛋，把它放在滾水裏，你確信蛋會被煮熟。

definition: black-boned chicken/silky fowl/silkie/Gallus gallus domesticus Brisson
fish maw/a food dish made from the swim bladder of fish
